title: Syrian gov’t troops deployed to Latakia, Tartous after deadly clashes
summary: The deployment comes after deadly unrest amid protests by the Alawite minority in the coastal cities.

title: How will Israel’s recognition of Somaliland impact the Middle East?
summary: Recognition of Somalia's breakaway region draws widespread condemnation.

title: S Korea’s ex-first lady accused of taking bribes, meddling in state affairs
summary: Kim Keon-hee took more than $200,000 in bribes and illegally intervened in state affairs, South Korean prosecutors say.

title: Seven Turkish police officers wounded in clash with ISIL fighters: Report
summary: A shootout ensues after police raid a home in northwestern Yalova province, local media reports say.

title: How do you carry a home that keeps breaking?
summary: An essay about Gaza, about leaving, and about carrying memories.

title: All the countries Israel attacked in 2025: Animated map
summary: Israel has carried out attacks in Palestine, Lebanon, Iran, Syria, Qatar and Yemen, as well as in maritime waters.

title: Fire at Indonesia retirement home kills 16 people
summary: Police say the fire at the Werdha Damai retirement home in the city of Manado killed 16 and wounded three others.

title: Train derails in southern Mexico, killing 13 and injuring dozens
summary: Mexico's Navy says the train was carrying 250 people when it derailed partially near the town of Nizanda in Oaxaca.

title: China launches drills around Taiwan in ‘stern warning’ to external forces
summary: Military carries out live firing around Taiwan, says more drills on Tuesday will simulate blockade of island's ports.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,404
summary: These are the key developments from day 1,404 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: North Korea’s Kim oversees test launch of long-range cruise missiles
summary: Kim urges 'unlimited and sustained' development of nuclear combat forces as North Korea gears up for key party congress.

title: Any Israeli presence in Somaliland will be a ‘target’: Houthi leader
summary: Israel on Friday announced it is officially recognising Somaliland, a first for the self-proclaimed republic since 1991.

title: Trump reçoit Netanyahu pour tenter de débloquer la deuxième phase de la trêve à Gaza
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien, Benjamin Netanyahu, rencontre, lundi, Donald Trump en Floride pour discuter de la deuxième phase de la trêve à Gaza, dans l’impasse. Washington veut accélérer le processus, tandis qu’Israël met en avant la question des otages et la menace iranienne.

title: Syrie : plusieurs personnes tuées dans une manifestation d'alaouites après l'attaque d'une mosquée
summary: Des milliers de manifestants appartenant à la communauté alaouite sont descendus dans la rue, dimanche, en Syrie, deux jours après l'attaque d'une de leurs mosquées qui a fait huit morts. Au moins trois personnes ont été tuées et des dizaines de personnes ont été blessées lors d'affrontements entre les différents groupes de manifestants et les forces de l'ordre.

title: Iran-Israël : le récit des 12 jours de guerre ouverte
summary: Du 13 au 24 juin 2025, Israël et l’Iran s'affrontent à coups de missiles et de frappes aériennes. Un conflit qui affaiblit considérablement la République islamique, touche durement certaines villes israéliennes et dont l'issue est décidée dans le Bureau ovale. En lettres capitales sur son réseau social, c'est Donald Trump qui lui a donné son nom : “La guerre des douze jours”. Récit.

title: Yémen : l'Arabie saoudite menace les séparatistes d'une action militaire
summary: "Dans le but de protéger la vie des civils", l'Arabie saoudite a menacé, samedi, d'une action militaire les séparatistes du Conseil de transition du sud au Yémen. Riyad, qui soutient le gouvernement yéménite, a appelé le STC à se retirer "pacifiquement" des provinces récemment conquises de Hadramout et Mahra.

title: Syrie : huit morts lors d'un attentat dans une mosquée à Homs
summary: Une explosion a frappé vendredi une mosquée située dans un secteur alaouite de la ville de Homs en Syrie, faisant huit morts, dernière attaque en date visant cette communauté musulmane minoritaire dans le pays.

title: Yémen : 15 000 combattants yéménites soutenus par l'Arabie saoudite massés à la frontière
summary: L'Arabie saoudite a été accusée vendredi par les séparatistes yéménites d'avoir bombardé leurs positions dans l'est du pays, un territoire dont ils se sont emparés le mois dernier. Quelque 15 000 militaires soutenus par l'Arabie saoudite sont également regroupés à la frontière depuis le début du mois, sans ordre d'avancer, a annoncé un responsable militaire.

title: Un Palestinien tue deux personnes dans le nord d'Israël
summary: Un Palestinien a attaqué vendredi deux personnes dans le nord d'Israël avant d'être blessé par des tirs. Une femme et un homme ont été tués, selon les secours israéliens et la police. Le ministre de la Défense israélien a demandé à l'armée d'agir "avec force" contre le village de l'assaillant.

title: Un groupuscule extrémiste sunnite revendique l'attaque contre une mosquée en Syrie
summary: ‍Au moins huit personnes ​ont été tuées, et 18 blessées vendredi dans une explosion qui a frappé une mosquée alaouite de Homs, dans l'ouest de la Syrie. Revendiquée par un groupuscule extrémiste sunnite dans un message posté sur Telegram, l'attaque a été condamnée par l'Onu et plusieurs pays de la région, ainsi que par la France, qui dénonce une tentative de déstabilisation.

title: Pour les chrétiens de Syrie, un Noël malgré les blessures, le deuil et l'inquiétude
summary: Un an après la chute du régime de Bachar al-Assad, les festivités de Noël se déroulent cette année sous le signe du deuil et de l’inquiétude pour les chrétiens de Syrie. À Damas et dans le village de Maaloula, la communauté chrétienne tente de célébrer, malgré les cicatrices laissées par les violences et un climat d’insécurité persistant.

title: Israël dit avoir tué un combattant de la force iranienne Al-Qods dans une frappe au Liban
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé avoir tué jeudi au Liban un "terroriste" de la force Al-Qods, branche des opérations extérieures des Gardiens de la révolution iraniens. Israël l'accusait de planifier des attaques "depuis la Syrie et le Liban".

title: Reconnaissance de la Palestine en 2025 : une victoire diplomatique, et après ?
summary: La reconnaissance de l’État de Palestine par plusieurs pays occidentaux en septembre, à l’initiative de la France, s'impose comme l'un des événements diplomatiques de l'année 2025. Ce tournant essentiellement symbolique pour les Palestiniens peut-il marquer la fin d’une impasse géopolitique vieille de plusieurs décennies ?

title: Noël à Gaza : une seule église reste debout dans l'enclave
summary: A Gaza, les fidèles se réunissent dans la seule église encore debout dans l'enclave devastée par la guerre.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Emmanuel Macron annonce une réunion des alliés de Kiev pour le début de janvier à Paris
summary: Le président français, qui s’est entretenu avec Volodymyr Zelensky après la rencontre de ce dernier avec Donald Trump en Floride, précise que les discussions serviront à « finaliser les contributions concrètes de chacun » pour les garanties de sécurité en cas de paix.

title: Au Kosovo, le parti du premier ministre, Albin Kurti, s’impose largement lors des législatives
summary: Les résultats préliminaires suggèrent que le parti VV pourrait s’approcher de la majorité absolue et permettre de tourner la page de l’instabilité politique après des mois de blocage institutionnel.

title: Après la rencontre entre Donald Trump et Volodymyr Zelensky, le chemin de la paix entre la Russie et l’Ukraine reste incertain
summary: Les présidents américain et ukrainien ont eu beau se féliciter devant la presse, dimanche, des conclusions de leur déjeuner de travail à Palm Beach, la perspective d’un accord pour mettre fin au conflit entre Kiev et Moscou, près de quatre ans après le début de la guerre, apparaît encore lointaine.

title: « Le Mondial de football 2026 s’annonce comme celui de l’“America first” » et surtout celui du “business first” »
summary: La Coupe du monde qui se déroulera notamment aux Etats-Unis, du 11 juin au 19 juillet 2026, ne sera ni neutre politiquement, ni abordable financièrement, ni inclusive, et en complète déconnexion avec les principes du football amateur, souligne Stéphane Lauer, éditorialiste au « Monde », dans sa chronique.

title: Israël, nouvelle obsession du monde MAGA
summary: Alors que le premier ministre israélien, Benyamin Nétanyahou, devrait rencontrer le président américain, Donal Trump, lundi 29 décembre à Miami, l’Etat hébreu est devenu un sujet de contentieux et de fantasme au sein du mouvement trumpiste.

title: En Italie, « le capital se concentre au sommet (…) tandis que le patrimoine de la moitié la plus pauvre s’est effondré »
summary: L’historien Giacomo Gabbuti et l’économiste Demetrio Guzzardi dressent, dans un entretien au « Monde », le portrait d’un pays où les inégalités explosent et où les instruments permettant de les combattre sont bloqués.

title: La Chine annonce le lancement d’exercices majeurs autour de Taïwan, qui répond avec un déploiement de « forces appropriées »
summary: Cette démonstration de force de Pékin intervient après des semaines de tensions avec le Japon, Tokyo ayant laissé entendre qu’il pourrait soutenir Taipei en cas de futur conflit armé. Ces manœuvres font également suite aux dernières ventes d’armes des Etats-Unis à Taïwan.

title: La Corée du Nord teste deux missiles de croisière à longue portée sous la supervision de Kim Jong-un
summary: Alors que Pyongyang multiplie les essais, son leader a appelé à un développement « illimité et soutenu » des forces nucléaires du pays.

title: A Berlin, une dangereuse fascination pour les pétards et feux d’artifice artisanaux
summary: Les syndicats de police et les associations de médecins réclament l’interdiction de l’usage d’articles pyrotechniques à titre privé, qui fait des victimes à chaque Nouvel An, mais la capitale allemande tient à sa culture libertaire et à sa réputation festive.

title: « L’économie chinoise est prise dans un cercle vicieux incompatible avec une révolution industrielle axée sur l’IA »
summary: Les deux économistes Di Guo et Chenggang Xu considèrent que la Chine ne peut pas rattraper son retard face aux Etats-Unis dans le domaine de l’intelligence artificielle. Ils rappellent qu’aucune révolution industrielle n’a vu le jour en dehors de systèmes capitalistes démocratiques.

title: La mort de Bahram Beyzaï, voix majeure du théâtre et du cinéma iranien malgré la censure et l’exil
summary: Figure incontournable de la dramaturgie et du cinéma iranien, il a marqué plus de six décennies de création, mêlant recherche sur la mythologie persane, théâtre rituel chiite et critique sociale.

title: Le Royaume-Uni annonce des restrictions sur les visas pour les citoyens de RDC
summary: Le ministère de l’intérieur accuse le pays d’avoir « échoué » à améliorer les procédures de retour des migrants qu’il voulait expulser. De son côté, le gouvernement congolais a annoncé être en discussion avec le Royaume-Uni, « afin de parvenir à une convergence de vues et trouver un accord » d’ici au 30 janvier.

title: Houthis say any Israeli presence in Somalia would be targeted militarily
summary:
Houthis say any Israeli presence in Somalia would be targeted militarily

Houthi leader Abdul Malik al Houthi on Monday said that the organisation condemns Israel's recognition of Somaliland as an independent state, adding that any Israeli presence in Somalia "will be a military target for our forces."

"The Israeli enemy, through its declaration, seeks to engage in hostile activities that threaten the security of the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden," he said in a statement broadcast on the Al Masirah television channel. 

He said that the Houthis would take "all possible means of support" to stand by the Somali people.

"We call on the Red Sea states and the Arab and Islamic world to take practical steps to prevent the Israeli enemy from violating Somalia's sovereignty," he added.

title: Netanyahu arrives in Florida to meet Trump
summary:
Netanyahu arrives in Florida to meet Trump

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday arrived in Florida ahead of his meeting with US President Donald Trump. 

Netanyahu will meet Trump to discuss the next stage of the fragile Gaza truce plan, news agency AFP reported. 

Trump, who said Netanyahu had asked for the talks, is reportedly keen to announce a Palestinian technocratic government for Gaza and the deployment of an international stabilisation force as soon as January. 

Israeli government spokeswoman Shosh Bedrosian said Netanyahu would discuss the second phase, which involves making sure that "Hamas is disarmed, Gaza is demilitarised."

AFP reported that Netanyahu will also try to "shift the focus onto Iran" during his fifth meeting in the United States with Trump this year, amid reports he will push for more US strikes on Tehran's nuclear program.

Netanyahu is wanted by the International Criminal Court for war crimes and crimes against humanity. 

Mayor of Dearbon Michigan, Abdullah Hammoud, has said that Dearborn police would arrest Netanyahu if he entered the city, calling on other cities to do the same.

New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani has made similar comments, vowing to arrest Netanyahu before he became mayor.

title: Wafa: Israeli forces detain students, teachers at checkpoint near Hebron
summary:
Wafa: Israeli forces detain students, teachers at checkpoint near Hebron

Israeli forces on Monday set up military checkpoints and blocked students and teachers from entering the Susya Mixed Basic School, south of Hebron, Palestinian media reported. 

Wafa news reported that Israeli forces set up a military checkpoint inside the village, where the students, along with teachers, were detained for a period of time and subjected to harassment at the checkpoint.

title: Hamas says Israel not honouring ceasefire, urges US action
summary:
Hamas says Israel not honouring ceasefire, urges US action

Hamas official Mahmoud Mardawi on Monday said that the organisation demands that the US administration put pressure on Netanyahu and implement the agreement in all its aspects.

"We want to complete the terms of the agreement and commit to moving to the second phase," he said. 

Mardawi said that the committee managing the Gaza Strip must be Palestinian, "reflecting the will of our people, and not a conduit for guardianship." 

He said that Israel does not abide by the ceasefire agreement and "continues to practice its policies of killing and starvation," adding the international community must not remain silent in the face of ongoing Israeli crimes.

title: Palestinian media report Israeli strikes on Khan Younis, Rafah, Bureij camp
summary:
Palestinian media report Israeli strikes on Khan Younis, Rafah, Bureij camp

Israeli military, in a continued escalation of violence, targeted Gaza with artillery and attacked the eastern areas of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip.

Palestinian media reported that Israeli warplanes also launched air strikes on the city of Rafah in southern Gaza.

An Israeli air strike targeted the eastern areas of the Bureij camp in central Gaza, the report said. 

Artillery shelling was also reported from the northern part of Bureij camp, where an Israeli helicopter opened fire.

title: Gaza officials say 4,000 embryos destroyed in Israeli bombing, births down 40%
summary:
Gaza officials say 4,000 embryos destroyed in Israeli bombing, births down 40%

The Gaza health ministry on Monday said that births have declined by 40 per cent, as Israel directly targeted the fertilisation centres and that the bombing of the Al Basma centre led to the burning of nitrogen pipes and the destruction of about 4,000 fertilised embryos.

The Director General of the Ministry of Health in Gaza, Munir Barsh, said that the region witnessed a significant increase in abortion cases, compared to a sharp decrease in the number of births by 40 per cent compared to last year, as monthly births declined from 26,000 to only 17,000 cases.

He said that low birth weight has become a widespread phenomenon as a result of maternal malnutrition.

title: Gaza officials say 418 Palestinians killed in ceasefire violations by Israel
summary:
Gaza officials say 418 Palestinians killed in ceasefire violations by Israel

The government media office in Gaza on Monday said that during the 80 days of the ceasefire agreement, the Israeli forces committed 969 violations, resulting in 418 killings.

The statement said that more than 1,141 Palestinians have been wounded during the same period, in addition to 45 cases of illegal arrest.

title: Heavy rain floods tents of displaced Palestinians in Gaza, warning issued
summary:
Heavy rain floods tents of displaced Palestinians in Gaza, warning issued

Heavy rain and wind flooded the tents of displaced Palestinians in Khan Younis on Monday, where eyewitnesses reported that floodwater destroyed what remained of the belongings of the displaced families.

The mayor of Khan Younis said that hundreds of tents were blown away by the strong winds accompanying the low-pressure system hitting the Gaza Strip. 

Palestinian media reported that, amid the absence of basic necessities of life, harsh weather conditions have continued to worsen the living conditions of displaced Palestinians.

With continued rain and rising water levels, the Deir al Balah municipality issued a warning asking displaced people to avoid areas around the valley streams near Abu Khasiwan neighbourhood, noting that the rising water levels of the stream pose a direct threat to their lives.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Gaza, where Israel continues to violate the ceasefire more than two months after it came into effect:

  • In Khan Younis, heavy rain, strong winds and rough sea conditions flooded the makeshift tents sheltering displaced Palestinians, with water seeping into areas where the tents had been set up.

  • The Deir al Balah municipality issued a warning asking displaced people to avoid areas around the valley streams near Abu Khasiwan neighbourhood, noting that the rising water levels of the stream pose a direct threat to their lives.

  • Israeli military, in a continued escalation of violence, targeted Gaza with artillery and attacked the eastern areas of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip.

  • Hamas official Mahmoud Mardawi said the organisation demands that the US administration put pressure on Netanyahu and implement the ceasefire agreement "in all its aspects".

  • Ten Palestinian prisoners were released by Israeli authorities and received at the hospital via the International Committee of the Red Cross, which provided them with medical care, without providing details about their health condition.

  • Artillery shelling fired by the Israeli military targeted the northern part of Al-Bureij camp in the central Gaza Strip.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Israel has carried at least 969 ceasefire violations since October 2025 and killed at least 418 Palestinians.

  • Only 19,764 aid trucks entered Gaza out of 48,000 required, the result has been ongoing shortages of food, medicine, water and fuel - worsening an already catastrophic humanitarian crisis.

  • Israeli occupation forces carried out separate raids in the occupied West Bank on Sunday evening, pushing into communities near Ramallah and Jenin, residents and security sources said.

  • Jewish settlers attacked the Bedouin community of Khilat al-Sidra, near the town of Mikhmas northeast of occupied Jerusalem, on Sunday evening, vandalising residents’ property, Palestinian officials said.

  • A Palestinian man was wounded on Sunday evening after an Israeli military vehicle rammed his car in the occupied West Bank city of Tulkarm, local sources told Wafa.

  • Israeli settlers cut down around 40 olive trees overnight in occupied East Jerusalem, according to Wafa news agency.

  • Israeli occupation forces detained five Syrian youths from Daraa governorate on Sunday as they searched for wild mushrooms on farmland near the town of Kodna in the southern countryside of Quneitra, Syrian state media reported.

  • Requests to relocate abroad by Israelis working at multinational companies operating in Israel rose in the past year in reaction to the war on Gaza, a report showed on Sunday.

title: Palestinian man wounded after Israeli military vehicle rammed his car
summary:
Palestinian man wounded after Israeli military vehicle rammed his car

A Palestinian man was wounded on Sunday evening after an Israeli military vehicle rammed his car in the occupied West Bank city of Tulkarm, local sources told Wafa.

The sources said an Israeli army vehicle struck the car of Fadi Marouh as he drove near Al-Quds Open University, leaving him injured and causing heavy damage to his vehicle.

An ambulance from the Palestinian Red Crescent Society transferred Marouh to Martyr Thabet Thabet Governmental Hospital for treatment, witnesses said.

After the collision, Israeli forces arrived at the scene and carried out search operations in the area, according to local accounts.

Residents say Israeli military vehicles move through Tulkarm around the clock, frequently speeding through main roads, including routes leading to the Tulkarm and Nur Shams refugee camps. Locals say the vehicles often drive against traffic, putting civilians at serious risk.

The incident comes as Israeli forces continue their assault on Tulkarm and its two refugee camps for the 336th consecutive day, amid intensified raids, restrictions and military presence across the city.

title: Houthis would target any Israeli presence in Somaliland, leader warns
summary:
Houthis would target any Israeli presence in Somaliland, leader warns

Submitted by Elis Gjevori on Sun, 12/28/2025 - 21:34
The Houthi leader warned that any Israeli presence in Somaliland would be a threat to Yemen and Somalia
A Yemeni lifts a portrait of Huthi leader Abdul Malik al-Houthi (AFP)
Off

The leader of Yemen’s Houthi group has issued a stark warning to Israel over its recognition of Somaliland, calling any Israeli presence in the breakaway region a “military target.”

“We consider any Israeli presence in Somaliland a military target for our armed forces, as it constitutes aggression against Somalia and Yemen, and a threat to the security of the region,” Houthi leader Abdul Malik al-Houthi said in a statement released online on Sunday.

Israel officially recognised Somaliland on Friday, a first for the self-declared republic that broke away from Somalia in 1991, in a move condemned internationally.

The recognition also drew condemnation from key regional players, including Turkey, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and Qatar.

Al-Houthi condemned the recognition as a “hostile stance targeting Somalia and its African surroundings, as well as Yemen, the Red Sea, and the countries along both shores of the Red Sea,” warning that it could carry serious consequences for regional stability.

Strategically positioned on the Gulf of Aden, Somaliland has long sought international recognition.

Regional and international condemnation 

Saudi Arabia's foreign ministry affirmed its full support for the "unity and territorial integrity" of Somalia. 

"The Kingdom expresses its rejection of the announcement of mutual recognition between the Israeli occupation authorities and the Somaliland region, considering it an action that entrenches unilateral secessionist measures that violate international law," it stated. 

It added that Riyadh rejected attempts to impose "parallel entities" that undermine Somalia's unity, and said it supported the "legitimate institutions of the Somali state".

Somaliland: How Trump, Saudi Arabia, Turkey and others reacted to Israeli recognition
Read More »

Turkey's foreign ministry said the recognition was "yet another example of the Netanyahu government's unlawful actions aimed at creating instability at both the regional and global levels".

"This step by Israel, whose expansionist policies persist and which spares no effort to prevent the recognition of the State of Palestine, amounts to an explicit intervention in Somalia's internal affairs," it said. 

On Saturday, Qatar's foreign ministry added its name to the list of countries to reject the recognition. 

Analysts suggest Israel’s engagement with Somaliland could expand its Red Sea access, potentially allowing it to attack Yemen. Israel has repeatedly targeted locations in Yemen since the outbreak of its war on Gaza in October 2023.

The Houthis have been one of the few regional actors that have sought to respond to the Israeli genocide through military means.

The Houthis have paused their attacks following a fragile truce in Gaza initiated in October.

Israel’s recognition of Somaliland has drawn widespread condemnation from the African Union, Egypt, Turkey and the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation, based in Saudi Arabia. The European Union stressed that Somalia’s sovereignty should be upheld.

Inside Yemen

title: Iran’s Armed Forces reaffirm readiness, pledging strong response to threats
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s top military bodies have reaffirmed their full readiness to defend the country, warning that any renewed hostile action by adversaries will be met with a far stronger and more damaging response than in the past.

title: Yemen’s Ansarullah urges Arab, Islamic support for Somalia
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Leader of Yemen’s Ansarullah movement Abdul-Malik al-Houthi has called on Arab and Islamic countries to take a firm and united stance in support of Somalia, warning that the Israeli regime’s recognition of Somaliland poses a serious threat to regional security.

title: Iran confirms successful receipt of first signals from newly launched satellites
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The first signals from three domestically built satellites of Zafar-2, Paya, and Kowsar were successfully received following their launch on Sunday evening, the minister of information and communications technology has said.

title: Iran holds natl. celebration for satellite launch
summary: Iran held a national celebration on Sunday evening (December 28, 2025) to mark the launch of three domestically built satellites. The event took place at the Institute for the Intellectual Development of Children and Young Adults and was attended by Communications and Information Technology Minister Sattar Hashemi, along with several members of parliament.

title: Iran, UAE FMs discuss regional developments over phone
summary: Tehran, IRNA — Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has held a phone call with his Emirati counterpart Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan, discussing bilateral relations and regional developments including Yemen.

title: Snowfall in Tabriz
summary: Winter snow blanketed the city of Tabriz, the capital of East Azarbaijan Province, on Sunday. Delighted by the snowfall, residents flocked to El Goli Park—one of the northwestern Iranian city’s most iconic landmarks—to enjoy and celebrate the wintry scene.

title: Iranian, Saudi foreign ministers discuss bilateral ties, regional developments on phone
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and Prince Faisal bin Farhan, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, held a telephone conversation on Sunday afternoon to discuss bilateral relations, as well as key regional and international developments.

title: Hezbollah chief says disarming resistance serves US-Israeli project
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Hezbollah’s Secretary-General Sheikh Naim Qassem says that calls to disarm the resistance were part of a joint US-Israeli project, arguing that such demands served Israel rather than Lebanon, while Israeli attacks on the country continue.

title: Exclusive | Venezuelans unfazed by US military threats, stand firmly with govt.: Analyst
summary: Tehran, IRNA - Angelo Giuliano, a Swiss-Italian activist and political analyst, who recently travelled to Venezuela, says the people of the South American country are firmly backing their government against aggression and the war of words launched by the United States.

title: Any new enemy mischief will be met with more decisive response: President
summary: President Masoud Pezeshkian has warned that Iran will give a more decisive response to any act of mischief by the enemies.

title: Death of Bahram Beyzai loss for Iran's artistic and cultural community: President
summary: Tehran, IRNA — President Masoud Pezeshkian has offered his condolences over the passing of Bahram Beyzai, one of the pioneers of Iranian cinema and theatre.

title: Iran launches three domestically built satellites aboard Russian Soyuz rocket
summary: Moscow, IRNA – Iran has launched three domestically built satellites into space aboard a Russian Soyuz rocket.

title: Any future talks with US must be based on diplomatic norms
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Iran has emphasized that any future negotiations with the United States must adhere to established diplomatic norms, amid ongoing reports of Iraqi efforts to facilitate a bilateral meeting in Baghdad.

title: Tehran rejects Guterres report as 'baseless'
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Iran has dismissed UN Secretary-General António Guterres’ recent report as lacking a legal basis, criticizing European countries for exploiting UN mechanisms under US pressure.

title: 7 Turkish police forces wounded in clash with ISIL fighters
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Seven Turkish police officers have been wounded in a shootout during an operation against alleged ISIL fighters, local media report.

title: Somaliland not recognized by any country: FM Spox.
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Iran’s Foreign Ministry dismissed Israel’s recognition of Somaliland as “meaningless,” warning it serves to destabilize the Horn of Africa and undermine regional unity.

title: Iran holds conference on Gen. Soleimani thoughts, efforts
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Tehran on Monday hosted an international conference named “Diplomacy and Resistance in the School of Lieutenant General Soleimani.”

title: Yemen warns of military action against Israelis in Somaliland
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – The leader of Yemen's Ansarullah resistance movement has said that any Israeli presence in Somaliland will be considered a military target, as it constitutes aggression against Somalia and Yemen.

title: Iran Army at peak readiness to confront enemies
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Iran’s Army warned that any hostile action by adversaries would receive a crushing response, reaffirming its full readiness to defend the nation.

title: Iran ready to respond forcefully to any hostile act
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Iran’s General Staff of the Armed Forces said it will not allow any harm to be inflicted on the country or its people, warning that any renewed hostile act would be met with a stronger response.

title: At least 13 people killed as train derails in Mexico
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – At least 13 people were killed, and 98 others were injured as a passenger train derailed in Mexico, according to the country's president, Claudia Sheinbaum.

title: Trump describes talks with Putin, Zelensky excellent
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump described his meeting with Ukraine’s Vladimir Zelensky in Florida and a phone call earlier on Sunday with his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, as excellent.

title: Space achievements reflect defiance of sanctions
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – Iran’s First Vice President Mohammad Reza Aref said the country’s space technologies clearly demonstrate national progress despite the unjust sanctions.

title: UAE taken measures to reduce tensions in Yemen, FM says
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 29 (MNA) – UAE Foreign Minister Sheikh Abdullah bin Zayed Al Nahyan said in a phone conversation with his Iranian counterpart that his country has taken measures to reduce tensions in Yemen.

title: حرم مطهر امام رضا(ع) در شب میلاد جوادالائمه (ع) گل‌باران می‌شود
summary: مشهد- حرم مطهر رضوی، در شب میلاد حضرت جوادالائمه (ع) با حضور زائران و مجاوران این آستان مقدس، گل‌باران می‌شود.

title: بازی با روح روان، کسب و کار تازه روانشناسان قلابی!
summary: یکی از اتفاقات آسیب‌زا در فضای مجازی که طی این چند وقت اخیر بیشتر از قبل رونق گرفته بلاگری با روانشناسی زرد است. اتفاقی که برای صاحبان صفحات مجازی لایک دارد و برای مخاطبانشان آسیب‌های روحی!

title: ساروی در جمع بزرگان جهان؛ کشتی‌گیر ایران رقیب ام‌باپه شد
summary: هادی ساروی، قهرمان نامدار کشتی ایران در فهرست نامزدهای عنوان برترین ورزشکار مرد سال ۲۰۲۵ جهان قرار گرفت.

title: جزئیات برنامه‌های ۹ و ۱۰ دی در ورامین اعلام شد
summary: ورامین- دبیر ستاد بزرگداشت یوم‌الله ۹ و ۱۰ دی ورامین، جزئیات برنامه‌های این ایام را تشریح کرد.

title: شنیده شدن صدای انفجار در دمشق
summary: شبکه الاخباریه سوریه از شنیده شدن صدای یک انفجار در دمشق خبر داد.

title: برگزاری نخستین تمرین صبحگاهی تیم ملی فوتبال زنان با محوریت ریکاوری
summary: دور جدید تمرینات تیم ملی فوتبال زنان با برگزاری نخستین جلسه تمرینی صبحگاهی و تمرکز بر ریکاوری بازیکنان از امروز در مرکز ملی فوتبال آغاز شد.
